titleStmt.title: A helpe to discourse. Or, A miscelany of merriment Consisting of wittie, philosophical and astronomicall questions and answers. As also, of epigrams, epitaphs, riddles, and iests. Together with the countrymans counsellour, next his yearely oracle or prognostication to consult with. Contayning diuers necessary rules and obseruations of much vse and consequence being knowne. By W.B. and E.P.
titleStmt.author: Basse, William, d. ca. 1653, attributed name.

Pond, Edward, d. 1629, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Bernard Alsop for Leonard Becket, and are to be sold at his shop in the Temple, neere the Church,

notesStmt.note: Often attributed to William Basse, Edward Phillips or Edward Pond; this attribution, however, is doubtful.
